intro: Astragalus skorpili, commonly known as the horned milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, spurred petals that resemble horns. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in racemes, which are typically followed by pods containing several seeds. Its root system is deep and robust, allowing it to thrive in arid and rocky environments. Astragalus skorpili is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
